description.description: The short description of the type of device that is schema is for.

schemaFeatureLevel.description: To prepare for evolving the Schema capabilities the feature level of the schema, starting at 1.

maxRegistersPerModbusRequest.description: Some devices do not allow fetching the full 125 registers at a time. This allows specifying that that limit.

blocks.description: All the Blocks of fields that make sense for this device.

tests.description: The tests that allow verification if the implementation is able to correctly read all Fields.

Schema.title: Modbus Schema
Schema.description: The Modbus Schema defines all there is for a device

id.description: Each Block must have unique ID

description.description: The description of what makes these Fields into this Block

fields.description: The list of all Fields of this Block. A Field is a single meaningful logical value that is calculated from the register values retrieved from the device.

Block.title: Modbus Schema Block
Block.description: A Block is a grouping of Fields that are all in the same memory area in the Modbus Device.

description.description: The description of the meaning of this Fields

immutable.description: True if this Field will never change on a running system. If not specified this is False.

system.description: True if this Field does not hold a meaningful value by itself (often an intermediate for a calculation) and can be left out for the users of the data. If not specified this is False.

expression.description: The expression that defined the relation between the registers and the final value.

unit.description: The unit of the value produced by this Field (like Volt, Amps, Celsius, etc.).

fetchGroup.description: Used to explicitly force the registers of multiple fields to be retrieved in a single Modbus request.

Field.title: Field
Field.description: A Field is a single meaningful logical value that is calculated from the register values retrieved from the device.

input.description: The input register blocks that are to be used by the tests.

blocks.description: The expected values for the Fields in the Blocks.

id.description: The ID of the Block for which the Fields need to be tested.

expected.description: The expected value for each Field that needs to be tested. The expected value is always an ARRAY, an empty Array means no value should be returned, and Array with 1 or more values makes it that those values must be returned in the defined order.
